radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver is normal in echotexture without focal abnormalities. No intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation. Common duct measures 4 mm. Main portal vein demonstrates normal hepatopetal flow. No ascites. The gallbladder is normal, without evidence of stones. No pericholecystic fluid, wall thickening, or other evidence of acute cholecystitis. The pancreatic head and body are unremarkable. The pancreatic tail is not well seen due to overlying bowel gas.
